text: Alessandro Pavolini (27 September 1903 â€“ 28 April 1945) was an Italian fascist, politician, journalist, and essayist. He was part of the Fascist Italian regime during World War II. ==Biography== === Early life === Pavolini was born in Florence. He earned a law degree at the University of Florence and a political science degree at La Sapienza in Rome. === Career === In the 1920s, he joined Benito Mussolini's movement in Florence. He was active in the Blackshirts and led a squad during the 1922 March on Rome. == Other websites == Category:1903 births Category:1945 deaths Category:Politicians from Florence
title: Alessandro Pavolini
